tql.tql:
SELECT * FROM airtable.get_records
  WHERE baseId=@baseId
  AND table='Interviewers'
  AND fields.Email=@email
  LIMIT 1

SELECT * FROM (SELECT * FROM airtable.get_records
  WHERE baseId=@baseId
  AND table='Applicants' EXPAND BY fields.`Onsite Interviewer` as interviewer, fields.`Applying for` as position)
  WHERE interviewer = @interviewerID

operations.description: Get the applicants that the interviewer has access to. Join in Information about the interviewer and the position.

tql.tql:
SELECT {...A.fields, id: A.id} FROM this.get_applicants as A JOIN this.get_interviewer as I
  ON A.interviewerID = I.id WHERE I.email = @email AND A.baseId=@baseId AND I.baseId=@baseId
  
 /*
  * Note: While the Airtable field name is `Email`, the operation parameter in this.get_interviewer is named (lowercase) `email`.
  * Thus, we use `I.email` to pass through the email parameter 
  */

v2.description: Layer permissions on top of an Airtable applicant tracking base, allowing interviewers to see only specific information.
